name: Perverticon - Extinguishing the Flame of Life (Vinyl)
description:
Perverticon, arguably an abomination that should have been strangled with its own umbilical cord, came into existence in late 2011. The ambition since then has been to create punishing and unrelenting, yet atmospherical black metal, firmly rooted in an intensive hatred towards this vermin-infested planet. The first manifestation of this is their debut album Extinguishing The Flame Of Life, released in the Winter of 2013 through Mordgrimm.

Released in a limited edition of 300, available now.

name: Hazarder - Against His-Story, Against Leviathan (Vinyl)
description:
"Hazarder are a hard-hitting Sludge/Stoner Metal Band heavily influenced by Sleep, Motorhead, Kyuss and High On Fire. Their blend of Sludge/Stoner Metal music is a thrilling blast of top-notch riffs from start to finish." [The Sludgelord] 

Named after the 1983 book on Anarcho-Primitivism by F. Perlman, Against His-Story, Against Leviathan! is an immense slab of colossal doom.

Co-released by Mordgrimm, Neanderthal Stench, Black Dawn Records, Insane Society and PMK Records

name: Primitive Man - Scorn (Vinyl)
description:
Hailing from Denver, Colorado, Primitive Man create a punishing blackened doom/sludge with traces of drone and d-beat. If you listen to bands such as The Body, Thou or Khanate then their earth-shattering, bleak wall of crushing dissonance and pure sonic heaviness is for you. Though Scorn is only the band’s debut full-length, it already sounds like one of the heaviest and most brutal records you’ll hear for a while. Thirty nine minutes of pure, unrelenting destruction that will leave you bruised and bleeding.

• Recorded by Dave Otero at Flatline Studio 
• Co-released by Mordgrimm and Throatruiner Records 
• 180-gram black vinyl with innersleeve and reverse-board cover 
• Includes free digital download

name: Totenwolf - Night Path of Pest
description: Nihilistic Black Metal from Moscow, Russia. Six scorching tunes that aren't for the faint of heart.

name: Grime - Deteriorate
description: Filth-Ridden, Crushing Sludge from Italy. Grime return with their second devastating album, featuring 8 songs that will flatten you.

name: Iron Fist #5
description:
UK Magazine

Iron Fist is a new magazine aimed squarely at connoisseurs. It will be a magazine that caters for the disciples of heavy metal, whether that be traditional or classic metal, black, death, thrash or power metal. Iron Fist is born out of passion for music and is a call to arms for other metal maniacs that want to reminisce about the genre’s early days while remaining hungry for the new blood keeping the scene alive. With Iron Maiden, Metallica, King Diamond and Black Sabbath ruling the summer stages at festivals and on worldwide tours, it is undisputed that heavy metal is back on top and Iron Fist will be the bi-monthly bible for those that can’t live without their denim and leather.

Dio
Satan
Tormentor
In Solitude
Sabbat
Jeff Hanneman RIP
Autopsy
Immolation
Virtue
Vemod
Pagan Altar

name: The Infernal Sea/Disinterred Split 7"
description:
This vinyl brings together The Infernal Sea (UK) and Disinterred (BEL) for this exclusive split 7" released via Death Mould Recordings.

Limited Edition run of only 200 
100 on Red Splatter effect Vinyl 
100 on Green Splatter effect Vinyl

Cover artwork by Adrian Baxter.

The track listing for the 7" is as follows.

Side A - The Infernal Sea 
1. Into the Unknown

Side B - Disinterred 
1. Apocalypse Beckons 
2. Once Bitten...

Every 7" comes with a digital download from both bands.

name: Balam - Balam
description:
Doom metal from Rhode Island

MCD

name: Blutvial - Curses Thorns Blood
description:
Relentless Black Metal

CD

name: Daudehaud - Nar Naturen Kaller
description:
Grim Norwegian black metal

CD

name: Grime - Grime
description:
Grime starts its mission in Trieste, Italy in summer 2010.
Their only goal is bringing destruction to a town near yours.
Their sound is rooted into rotten burial ground and their songs are the sound of a decaying swamp filled with trash. 
Their slow and heavy groove is filthy and vicious, guitar riffs are sharp and covered with rust, drums and bass hit with the unstoppable power of a mud avalanche 

MCD

name: Huata - Atavist of Mann
description:
The European Doomkrieg is summoning

CD

name: Lychgate - Lychgate
description:
Lychgate blend the mood of experimental doom with the execution of soundscape & melody-driven black metal. The result is something avant garde, expressive, atmospheric, and altogether unique.

CD

name: Lychgate - Lychgate Vinyl
description:
Lychgate blend the mood of experimental doom with the execution of soundscape & melody-driven black metal. The result is something avant garde, expressive, atmospheric, and altogether unique.

180g Vinyl LP

description:
Torturous Sludge/Doom Metal from Auckland, New Zealand.

description:
British Black Metal

name: Old Forest - Into the Old Forest
description:
Classic debut album from cult UK horde

name: Old Forest - Tales of the Sussex Weald
description:
OLD FOREST are a Black Metal band playing music in the anti-commercial style of the early 90s. Based in the county of Sussex (South East England), they explore the myths, legends and aura of the land in which they were born.

CD

name: Runes of the Evening - Runes of the Evening
description:
Phenomenal Death/Black metal from Texas

CD

name: Sepuku - Demo and Live Perversions
description:
Sleazy, deathrashing filth from London

Cassette

name: Serpent Omega - Serpent Omega Vinyl
description:
Vomited from the mouth of the Great Serpent in 2011, Serpent Omega are a brooding, 
powerful beast of a band from Stockholm, Sweden, who meld doom, black metal, sludge 
and crust punk to create blood-stirring, earth-shattering riffs. Influenced by bands 
such as High on Fire, Sleep and Black Sabbath, their sound is sometimes guttural, 
sometimes mesmeric but always coupled with a pounding malevolence; the band live by 
the maxim that you should not only listen to music, you need to feel it.


LP

name: Shaidar Logoth - Chapter 1: The Peddler
description:
Raw Ambient Black Metal

CD

name: The Solemn Curse - Gateways to Eternity
description:
The band collectively includes members of: Towers of Flesh, Binah, Necrotize, Theoktony, Throes, Labyrinth and Mindless Torture. 

CD

name: Alchemical Manifestations - A Transylvanian Funeral/Plutonium Shore Split CD
description:
Two USBM adepts emerge from the void and chaos to create 'Alchemical Manifestations'. Plutonian Shore offer up all new recordings, two in the studio, two from the stage and a re-interpretation of the Rotting Christ classic, 'The Fifth Illusion'. A Transylvanian Funeral brings 4 all-new sacrifices to the ritual altar, with Sleepwalker again performing and producing all instruments exclusively.

CD

name: A Transylvanian Funeral - Gorgos Goetia
description:
Twelve Rituals of Primitive Black Magick in the form of Gorgos Goetia

CD

name: Abomnium - Coffinships
description:
Second album from this one man extreme metal killing machine. Features nine tracks of blasting and raging extreme black/death metal. For fans of (old) Mayhem, Immortal and Nachtmystium, receiving fantastic reviews.

CD Ltd to 100 copies

name: Desolate Shrine - The Sanctum of Human Darkness
description:
Over a year and a half after decimating ear drums with the sounds from their debut album "Tenebrous Towers," Desolate Shrine returns with their highly anticipated and very dark sophomore release. "The Sanctum of Human Darkness" is nearly 55 minutes of dark, misanthropic death metal which is a reminder why Finland remains home to some of the nastiest death metal today. Aesthetics once again handled by the band's own L.L..

CD

name: Forbidden Magazine Issue 3
description: 52 Pages Black and White Side Stitched 52 Pages of unforgiving black death worship from the world of extreme music! Interviews include: CRYPTOPSY MANETHEREN WHIPSTRIKER HYPNOS PLUTONIAN SHORE ISRATHOUM MOONREICH DARKEST GROVE NETRA ECTOVOID OAKMOON plus 8 pages of reviews!

name: Frigoris - Wind
description: Although founded as a Pagan/Black Metal band, Frigoris has steadily developed their sound since its foundation around head Dominik Winter in 2007 and now stands as a high-level atmospheric, melodic Black Metal band. The new record Wind is the current peak of this development and highlights Frigoris' ability in mixing ferocious black metal with acoustic guitars and folk sensibilities. The over fifty minute piece is filled with a surpassing emotional intensity that creates a bond between pure aggression and deep melancholy.

name: Galaktik Cancer Squad - Ghost Light
description: From the vacuous depths of space, the great pathogenic force of Galaktik Cancer Squad will once again return to haunt the aural realms of the earth with their first ever physical release, ‘Ghost Light.’ An ambitious one-man project from Germany, Galaktik Cancer Squad was formed by Arwohn in 2011 and has to the point before Ghost Light released four albums digitally. Aggressive, and experimental post-black metal with cacophonous discordant vocals combine with moments of soaring post-rock melancholy that make you soar to other dimensions. Simultaneously mind-bending and sky-searing, Galaktik Cancer Squad on a physical medium for the first time ever captures the best of the project yet. Extremely well-written and forward thinking experimental black metal, embrace summer, sun, and the galaktik cancer squad!

name: Goatcraft - All for Naught
description:
Necroclassical

CD

name: Gorephilia - Embodiment of Death
description:
A viscosity of riffs that are thicker than blood, soak the weapons' edges that inflict the highest offences and wounds of blasphemy and pain, on terrified third parties.

CD

name: Krypts - Unending Degradation
description:
Festering in the underground since their inception in 2008, Helsinki-based Krypts are prepared to set free their debut full-length. While the trademark Krypts' sounds from the 2009 demo and 2011 EP are there (lumbering low-end, bone-crunching riffs and toxic vocals), "Unending Degradation" showcases a band which has honed their craft and is ready to deliver one of 2013's must-have death metal releases. Open the Crypt and enter...

CD

name: Lantern - Below
description:
After letting the dust of their acknowledged 2011 EP settle, Finland's LANTERN have returned to deliver a new, far more epic slab of dark and atmospheric death metal performed in the ancient vein. LANTERN's debut album "Below" is a relentless plunge into the unfathomable darkness these compositions are born of, presented in the band's unique style of carefully crafted yet filthy and morbid metal. Compiling seven strongly distinct macabre tales and covering thirty-eight minutes, "Below" is a definitive statement of a band in top form and demonstrates that death's not dead.

Brilliant artwork/layout by Alex Brown. Booklet printed on heavy cardboard stock.

name: Lycanthia - Oligarchy
description: Formed in 1996, Lycanthia carries with them a history spanning 17 years and are one of Australia's oldest surviving doom metal bands. A six piece band hailing from Sydney, Lycanthia plays traditional gothic death-doom metal with a strong emphasis on atmosphere, melody, and the captivating use of alternating male growls and female soprano vocals. Comparisons could be drawn between Lycanthia and the sound found in the early "golden age" works of classic gothic doom bands such as My Dying Bride, Paradise Lost, Draconian, and Theatre of Tragedy. A flagship of this particular sound is the contrast between dark, aggressive, and heavy death-doom and softer moments courtesy of female vocals, keyboards, and violin arrangements and Lycanthia does this extraordinarily well. The growls courtesy of founding member and bassist Lee Tassaker is a definite strong point of the album, and contrasts nicely with the poignant female vocals from violinist and keyboardists, Vanessa Black, and Megan Tassaker. The vocal work is complimented nicely by six very competent musicians all working towards a heavy, despairing, and powerfully melancholic sound and a production quality that does the songwriting justice. Mastered by Jens Bogren at Fascination Street Studios (Opeth, Katatonia), the re-release of Oligarchy on Hypnotic Dirge comes in a digipack format with an 8 page foldout booklet.

name: Maveth - Coils of the Black Earth
description:
Formed in 2007, Finland's Maveth finally break through with their debut full-length. Showing their strength through live shows and their two releases (2010's EP "Of Serpent and Shadow" and 2011's demo "Impious Servant"), Maveth gave us a glimpse of their suffocating and brutal style. Now Maveth is here to fully showcase their brand of utter domination in the form of "Coils of the Black Earth." Almost one hour in length, "Coils..." is a haunting release both sonically and aesthetically featuring artwork by the infamous Daniel Desecrator. Prepare for annihilation.

CD

name: Necrogrinder - The Bunty Man
description:
Brand new e.p. from this brutal, intense and slamming death/grind mob. Punishing songs with a huge production and in-human vocals, this will definitely appeal to fans of Pathology, Prostitute Disfigurement, Torsofuck etc.

Very limited

CD

name: Nethermost - Alpha
description: Nethermost's debut EP release ¨Alpha,¨ a tribute to nature and the four elements paints a deep and obscure timelessness while offering up powerful and intense melodies and an overall rich atmosphere soaked in ambience and melancholy. Mid-paced melodic doom metal with an emphasis on atmosphere, a thick bass sound and deep vocals conjure up an honest organic sound rooted in the mid-90's death-doom sound. Alpha, while providing an introduction to a new and promising doom band should also appeal to fans of established bands, Katatonia - circa Brave Murder Day, October Tide, and Daylight Dies

name: Odradek Room - Bardo. Relative Reality
description: Named after one of Franz Kafka's short stories, Odradek Room is an atmospheric and progressive death-doom band with post-rock leanings from Mariupol, Ukraine. Initially formed in 2008 under the name 'Shards of Silence', the past five years has given the band ample time to develop and refine their sound for their debut album 'Bardo. Relative Reality.' Creating dynamic and profound music, rich in tempo and mood variation, Odradek Room has crafted an extremely strong debut which perfectly shows the duality between the aggressive and melancholic sides of death-doom combining slow plodding riffs, soaring emotional melodies, post-rock leanings, and a psychedelic touch to create a rich canvas of sonic majesty. A conceptual album based on the ideas of the Tibetan Book of the Dead and surreal images of the subliminal consciousness, the album consists of seven songs and an hour playtime, released in a digipack with a 12 page booklet including the full album's lyrics in both Russian and English, since it was very important to the band for the lyrical concept of this work to be comprehensible in both languages. Unique, mature, and with a well-defined personality, Bardo. Relative Reality. is a highly recommended debut album from this young Ukrainian band.

name: The Deathisodes - Inside the Universe of Horror
description:
Second album from this amazing collective of extremely talented UK artists. Raging melodic death metal for fans of Scar Symmetry and Soilwork. Based around one man (Alex Loader), this album features a multitude of guest musicians: Josh McMorran (Bloodshot Dawn), Benjamin Ellis (Bloodshot Dawn), Doug Anderson (Bloodshot Dawn), James Baille-Hamilton (Cryostorm), Jack Giddon (Cryostorm), Elliott Alderman-Bloom (Cambion) + MORE!!!

Very limited

CD

name: Ulfarr/ Hrafnblóð - Wulfhere Split CD
description:
Split cd with both bands playing raw, bleak, atmospheric and utterly devastating black metal

CD Ltd to 100 copies
